Tanikawa was born in Suginami, Japan. The English translation of his poetry volume Floating the River in Melancholy won the American Book Award in 1989. Tanikawa has written more than 60 books of poetry and also translated Charles Schulz's Peanuts and the Mother Goose rhymes into Japanese. He was nominated for the 2008 Hans Christian Andersen Award.
